content: skipton gloves by liz thompson a double thickness cuff means that these warm-as-toast gloves in lambswool and kid mohair will keep your fingers cosy on even the coldest day yarn rowan kid classic 70% lambswool 26% kid mohair 4% nylon 140 m/153 yds per 50g ball colour 841 lavender ice 1 ball mc rowan kid classic 70% lambswool 26% kid mohair 4% nylon 140 m/153 yds per 50g ball colour 852 victoria 1 ball cc needles set of five 3 25m double pointed needles gauge 12 stitches and 15 row to 2 inches notions yarn needle several pieces smooth waste yarn 3 5mm crochet hook 2 stitch markers abbreviations mc = main colour cc = contrast colour k = knit p = purl m1 = make 1 stitch by knitting into the back of the horizontal loop before the next stitch k2tog = knit two stitches together right-leaning decrease ssk = slip slip knit left-leaning decrease pm = place marker sm = slip marker cuff both gloves the same using the crochet hook and waste yarn cast on 40 stitches using a provisional crochet cast on round 1 using cc knit 40 stitches divide evenly between three needles and join for working in the round being careful not to twist the stitches rounds 2-32 k3 p1 around round 33 change to mc k3 p1 around rounds 34-56 k3 p1 around weave in the ends of the yarns securely at the point where you changed colours carefully undo the crochet cast on and slip the resulting live stitches onto another piece of waste yarn fold the cc section inside the mc section to create a double layer you are now going to knit the stitches of round 1 together with the stitches of round 56 to close up the top of the cuff round 57 slip the first ten cc stitches from the waste yarn onto the spare double pointed needle knit the first mc stitch together with the first cc stitch knit next mc stitch together with next cc stitch repeat to end of round all mc stitches have been knit together with cc stitches gusset left hand glove round 1 k15 pm k2 pm k23 round 2 k to first marker sm m1 k to second marker m1 sm k to end of round 42 stitches round 3 k around round 4 k to first marker sm m1 k to second marker m1 sm k to end of round 44 stitches rounds 5-12 repeat rounds 3 and 4 four times 52 stitches 14 stitches between markers round 13 k around repeat round 13 seven times or until the glove reaches to the base of your thumb next round k15 place next 14 stitches on waste yarn k23 38 stitches next round k around repeat previous round nine times or until glove reaches the base of your fingers fingers and thumb left hand glove use cc throughout little finger place the first 5 stitches of the round on one double
